DataElement.preferredDefinition: The condition, disease, symptom or disorder that the procedure was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered or the procedure performed).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._The condition, disease or disorder that the procedure is intended to investigate or address.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 2021-6-9 ak 12/18/18 TT released/MC. Created as part of CDISC mapping task. mc

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the reason the procedure was performed based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If performed to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If performed to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).

ReferenceDocuments.name: PRINDC
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the reason(s) why a procedure was performed. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (e.g., in the classification of procedures), for reconciling the procedures performed on a subject with their provided medical history and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process, etc.

ReferenceDocuments.description: For what indication, was the [PRTRT] performed?
